html: (2 Nephi 15:12)."The harp, and the viol, the tabret, and pipe." The pleasure seekers will fill their feasts and places of entertainment with the music of the world. The instruments cited "viol" (a lyre or lute a hand-held stringed instrument), "tabret" (a small drum), "pipe" (flute) are simply symbolic of the worldly merriment associated with the people's pursuit of pleasure.
